data.sampled: True. According to Rule 1.1 of the ABA Model Rules of Professional Conduct, a lawyer should provide competent representation to clients. To do so, a lawyer must be familiar with the law and legal principles applicable to the client's case and must also take reasonable steps to avoid representing clients with conflicts of interest. Thus, a lawyer must prepare for legal problems with which they are not familiar by seeking special training or consulting with other lawyers who have the necessary knowledge and skills.
